refnamediv.refpurpose: Opens a dialog for selecting a color.

refsynopsisdiv.title: Syntax
refsynopsisdiv.synopsis: uigetcolor() RGB = uigetcolor([title]) RGB = uigetcolor([title,] defaultRGB) RGB = uigetcolor([title,] defaultRed, defaultGreen, defaultBlue) [R, G, B] = uigetcolor([title]) [R, G, B] = uigetcolor([title,] defaultRGB) [R, G, B] = uigetcolor([title,] defaultRed, defaultGreen, defaultBlue)

listitem.para: String: Optional argument, the title to display in the dialog. Default value is "Color Chooser".
1x3 vector: the default values for Red, Green and Blue values given as a vector [red, green, blue].
Scalar: the default value for red.
Scalar: the default value for green.
Scalar: the default value for blue.
1x3 vector: the values for Red, Green and Blue values given as a vector [red, green, blue] or [] if the user cancels.
Scalar: the value for red or [] if the user cancels.
Scalar: the value for green or [] if the user cancels.
Scalar: the value for blue or [] if the user cancels.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Creates a dialog window for selecting a color. All (default and returned) values must be in the interval [0 255].

refsection.title: Examples
refsection.programlisting: uigetcolor() [R, G, B] = uigetcolor([255 128 0]) RBG = uigetcolor(0, 128, 255) RBG = uigetcolor("My color chooser", 0, 128, 255)
